Tairāwhiti news digest: Beach cleanup progress, Thursday fires, weather impacts grape harvest https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/tairawhiti-news-digest-beach-cleanup-progress-thursday-fires-weather-impacts-grape-harvest/JXWBUUD2QJGUXJNKKDHNYMJW7A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/tairawhiti-news-digest-beach-cleanup-progress-thursday-fires-weather-impacts-grape-harvest/JXWBUUD2QJGUXJNKKDHNYMJW7A/ Murray RobertsonContractors have made fast progress in removing latest debris buildup on city beaches. Photo / Murray Robertson
Prime Minister’s Scholarships: Former Bethlehem College student going to India, Japan https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/prime-ministers-scholarships-former-bethlehem-college-student-going-to-india-japan/NRR5BIJZEZCBBMW27F4IAIZSOQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/prime-ministers-scholarships-former-bethlehem-college-student-going-to-india-japan/NRR5BIJZEZCBBMW27F4IAIZSOQ/ Megan Wilson'I never ever thought I would get anything like this before.' Fri, 10 Jan 2025 01:00:00 +0000 Former Bethlehem College student Lauryn Maxwell is going to India and Japan in 2025 for two six-week internships thanks to receiving two Prime Minister’s Scholarships.
